22 Liger.[2 Octob.]
SEint leger a bischop was &punctelev; and holi man inou&yogh;
Mani a man þoru&yogh; is prechingue &punctelev; to godes lawe he drou&yogh;
A luþur Iustise þare was nei&yogh;h &punctelev; Ebrom[r. Ebroin] was is name
Men tolden him, ase he wende aboute &punctelev; of seint legeres fame
he liet him wel sone nime &punctelev; and bifore him bringue
And fondede forto tuyrne is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; fram þe heuene kingue
þo he ne mi&yogh;hte þat don nou&yogh;t &punctelev; he was wroth inou&yogh;
Ane luþere man he cleopede sone &punctelev; þat boþe is ei&yogh;ene ou&yogh;t drou&yogh;
¶ Þo is ei&yogh;ene in grete pine &punctelev; weren iholede out boþe
he gan þe more prechi of god. &punctelev; þarefore huy weren wroþe
A wei þer was of scharpe stones &punctelev; and opward stoden echon
Þareoppe þis holie man &punctelev; barefot huy maden gon
huy driuen him barefot and ablend &punctelev; ope þis scharpe stones þere
Þis guode man eode wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase þei him noþing nere
And euere he prechede on Iesu crist— &punctelev; he ne bilefte for no fere
¶ For is longue prechingue þe luþere men &punctelev; wroþest with him were
huy coruen of is tongue anon &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht bi is þrote aboue
Þare schewede ore swete louerd &punctelev; fair Miracle for is loue
For þo is tongue was of icorue &punctelev; &yogh;eot he prechede faste
And also wel as he dude er. &punctelev; þo weren þe schrewes agaste
huy bispeken to don him more schame &punctelev; ake huy weren sumdel in doute
huy [sto]den[unreadable.] and biheolden is heued &punctelev; and þo[MS. þe?] isei&yogh;en huy þare|aboute
A ro[un]d croune and swiþe cler— &punctelev; bri&yogh;htore ne mi&yogh;hte non beo
Þat vnneþe huy mi&yogh;hten is holie heued &punctelev; for þe leome iseo
¶ Þis luþere Iustise het anon &punctelev; þat men smiten of is heued
Four tormentores he was bitake &punctelev; þat it nere nou&yogh;t bileued
huy ladden him withoute toun &punctelev; for[to] don þat dede
Ase huy comen amidde þe wei &punctelev; þis holie man to heom seide
"&YOGH;wat neode is it forto trauailli &punctelev; ferrore me to lede
Dothþ anon þat &yogh;e scholden do &punctelev; here ri&yogh;ht, ich eou rede."
Þe þreo quellares of þis word &punctelev; anon weren in grete drede
To is fet huy feollen akneo &punctelev; and for&yogh;iuenesse him bede
Þarefore was þe feorþe wroth &punctelev; forth he hupte sone
And smot of þe guode mannes heued &punctelev; ase he hadde heste to done
¶ Sone þareaftur cam a fuir &punctelev; ase it of helle were
And al quik furbarnde him &punctelev; and þe deuelene awei him bere
Seint leger was wel faire ibured. &punctelev; is soule to heouene wende
And for þat bodi, ase it on eorþe lai &punctelev; fair miracle ore louerd sende
¶ Þe luþere Iustise þat him liet aquelle &punctelev; þereof heorde telle
two &yogh;er aftur þulke tyme &punctelev; þat he him liet aquelle
To is toumbe ane kni&yogh;ht he sende &punctelev; þe soþe forto fonde
Þo þe kni&yogh;ht to þe toumbe cam &punctelev; þarebi he gan stonde
"In schendnesse," he seide, "mote he dei&yogh;e &punctelev; and in strongue deþe also
hoso bilieuethþ þat dede men &punctelev; ani miracle mouwen do!"
Wel filliche also þe toumbe he smot. &punctelev; and anonri&yogh;ht with þe dede
Oppon him feol is owene bone &punctelev; ase he bad and seide
For deuelene astrangleden him anon— &punctelev; for al redie þare huy were
And is soule, ase it was ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; adeuele wei huy bere
¶ Þe Iustise sone þareafturward &punctelev; to deþe was ido
And aslawe in grete schendnesse &punctelev; and adeuele wei wende also
Þus was þe bischop seint leger &punctelev; awreke of is fon
And he himsulf to þe Ioie of heouene &punctelev; after is deþe gan gon
Nou god for þe loue of seint leger &punctelev; is swete grace us siende
Þat we aftur þusse liue &punctelev; moten to þe Ioye of heouene wiende
